prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom The first part of the CAD assembly is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The front face is angled at approximately 45 degrees from the top and bottom faces, and the object is centered on a white background. Step 1: Create a new coordinate system Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0315, 0.0] Step 2: Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the newly created coordinate system. Step 5: Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the following Euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0315, 0.0] Step 6: Extrude the 3D sketch to create the prism Extrude the 3D sketch along the Z-axis by a distance of 0.0315 to create the prism. The height of the prism is 0.75. The length is 0.75 and width is 0.0315. Step 7: Create a new body Create a new body as the first part of the CAD assembly. The resulting shape matches the description in the JSON: "A three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The front face is angled at approximately 45 degrees from the top and bottom faces. The object is centered on a white background."</description>

Draw the sketch as follows: * Line 1: Start point [0.0, 0.0], End point [0.625, 0.0] * Line 2: Start point [0.625, 0.0], End point [0.625, 0.1098] * Line 3: Start point [0.625, 0.1098], End point [0.0, 0.1098] * Line 4: Start point [0.0, 0.1098], End point [0.0, 0.0] 4. Sketch the outline of the prism on face\\_1 using 4 lines: - line\\_1: Start Point (0.0, 0.0), End Point (0.2442, 0.0) - line\\_2: Start Point (0.2442, 0.0), End Point (0.2442, 0.2442) - line\\_3: Start Point (0.2442, 0.2442), End Point (0.0, 0.2483) - line\\_4: Start Point (0.0, 0.2483), End Point (0.0, 0.0) Extrude the sketch by 0.3214 units in the opposite direction of the normal. **Instructions for final model:** Combine part\\_1 and part\\_2 to create the final 3D model of a rectangular prism with a smaller rectangular prism on top of it, positioned diagonally and centered on the larger one, and symmetrical along the diagonal axis. The larger prism has dimensions length: 0.75, width: 0.3214, and height: 0.75, while the smaller prism has dimensions length: 0.2482, width: 0.3214, and height: 0.2482.</description>
